posts.post_content:
Since when was 3 mana for a 3/4 defender with a relevant protection overcosted?   
  
Obviously for limited (barring the off green early defender deck), but this can be REALLY strong in limited. You're killing the entire early board, especially for aggressive decks with [Bloodcrazed Neonate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodcrazed Neonate) or similar (this also shuts down [Geist of Saint Traft](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geist of Saint Traft)) , and decks that went for small/fast/cheap are going to have a really hard time getting over this. All of that even better when it can pick up a block on a zombie.  
  
Cards like this enable more complex late game strategy's for limited, I've played this early game, got a few hits in with some [festerhide boar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=festerhide boar) before sacing this to an [infernal plunge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=infernal plunge) to play a [Brimstone volley](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brimstone volley) for the win. All of this as my opponent had just played his [balefire dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=balefire dragon) to attack next turn for the win, a win that never came for him :)
posts.html:
Since when was 3 mana for a 3/4 defender with a relevant protection overcosted?

Obviously for limited (barring the off green early defender deck), but this can be REALLY strong in limited. You're killing the entire early board, especially for aggressive decks with Bloodcrazed Neonate or similar (this also shuts down Geist of Saint Traft) , and decks that went for small/fast/cheap are going to have a really hard time getting over this. All of that even better when it can pick up a block on a zombie.

Cards like this enable more complex late game strategy's for limited, I've played this early game, got a few hits in with some festerhide boar before sacing this to an infernal plunge to play a Brimstone volley for the win. All of this as my opponent had just played his balefire dragon to attack next turn for the win, a win that never came for him :)

posts.post_content: With all the PvZ discussion going on, you guys are completely forgetting that this is one of the few half-decent defenders with actual power behind it. [Wall of Denial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Denial) is a great card, but it doesn't stop them from attacking in full force again the next turn. This will shut down attackers, and laugh heartily at zombies.

had a couple of these at the prerelease running G/W. one is foil, it looks sick with the sun and parts of the ground that stick out glowing :D

Posted By: dontmess17 (10/30/2011 9:11:42 AM)

posts.post_content:
I really like this card. And I really like how it just shuts down Zombie decks, giving control the chance to stabilize. [Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler), [Dreg Mangler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dreg Mangler), [Geralf's Messenger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geralf's Messenger) (even after Undying), and [Lotleth-Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotleth-Troll) (w/ less than 2 discards) all die to it, and it can block everything they can throw at you until they get out one of their non-zombie flyers in the later game.  
  
This might end up a *seriously* viable sideboard card for Control decks that utilize Green, assuming Jund Zombies ends up a competitive deck.
posts.html:

This might end up a seriously viable sideboard card for Control decks that utilize Green, assuming Jund Zombies ends up a competitive deck.

posts.post_content:
Plants Vs. Zombies! MaRo confirmed this via Twitter. For those who don't know, the creators of Plants Vs. Zombies had a certain amount of inspiration for some aspects of the game because of Magic: the Gathering. As such, this is Magic's tribute to that game, and it's even more fun for the number of players who get the reference (i.e. 90% of the people at your LGS).  
  
I can't help but smile every time I see this card. Glad to see Wizards has a sense of humor. The "Defender" ability was a really nice touch.
posts.html:
Plants Vs. Zombies! MaRo confirmed this via Twitter. For those who don't know, the creators of Plants Vs. Zombies had a certain amount of inspiration for some aspects of the game because of Magic: the Gathering. As such, this is Magic's tribute to that game, and it's even more fun for the number of players who get the reference (i.e. 90% of the people at your LGS).

I can't help but smile every time I see this card. Glad to see Wizards has a sense of humor. The "Defender" ability was a really nice touch.
